title: How to Make a Cake in Minecraft

steps.title: Get three buckets of milk.
steps.content: Get three buckets of milk. To get milk, right click on a cow while your character is holding a bucket.

steps.title: Get one chicken egg.
steps.content: Get one chicken egg. These are laid by chickens, which can be found in the wilderness. You can also keep chickens if you capture them inside a fence.

steps.title: Get two sugar.
steps.content: Get two sugar. Sugar is made from sugarcane and can only be eaten when used as an ingredient in a recipe.

steps.title: Get three wheat.
steps.content: Get three wheat. This acts as "flour" for the cake. Wheat can be farmed or it can be found in dungeon chests.

steps.title: Place the ingredients into the crafting grid.
steps.content: Place the ingredients into the crafting grid. The following pattern is required: Place three buckets of milk across the top three slots. Place one sugar to the left of the center slot, and one to the right. Place the egg in the center slot. Place the wheat in the remaining three bottom slots of the grid.

steps.title: Craft your cake.
steps.content: Craft your cake. To remove to the inventory, shift click or drag. Three empty milk buckets will also be returned to your inventory automatically.

steps.title: Place the cake block down on another block.
steps.content: Place the cake block down on another block. You cannot eat cake by holding the block. [1] X Research source You cannot place a cake where you're not able to build.

steps.title: Right click on the cake to eat a slice.
steps.content: Right click on the cake to eat a slice.

steps.title: Share your cake.
steps.content: Share your cake. It is possible to share slices of cake with other players if you want to because there are six slices in each cake block. Enjoy your Minecraft cake! You can create servers to allow your friends to play with you from different devices. [2] X Research source For example, you can use a Minecraft pocket edition server. [3] X Research source It is a Minecraft world on the mobile version of the game. [4] X Research source
